analytic.title: L’évêque Alexandre d’Apamée et son église à Haouarté

biblStruct.note: The site of Hawarte, excavated and published by P. Canivet and M. T. Fortuna Canivet, has recently revealed an underground cave dedicated to the cult of Mithra. After its destruction and filling-up, this mithraeum was replaced by a first church, which has not been precisely dated. The discovery of a new baptistery associated to this first church in Hawarte has enlightened the site’s chronology. Two inscriptions, one on the mosaic and the other on the entrance lintel, give a date of 420/421 for the construction, under bishop Alexander. The church itself is probably contemporary. The destruction of the mithraeum must have occurred shortly before.
